climbs.name: Eva Las Vegas
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, & Eva Fitts

content.description: This route is located on the left side of the upper Bond Boulder, left of RCA. The balancy crux is encountered early, and pleasant slab climbing continues to the anchor. A very worthwhile addition to the area.

climbs.name: RCA
climbs.fa: Ron Carson, Brett Maurer and Tony Yaniro, 1983

content.description:
This short route is found on the northern Bond Boulder and offers fun climbing on good rock.

Slab your way up the center of the boulder passing a small roof/overlap midway to anchors on top. A good route for those who enjoy quality slab climbing.

Cimbs a very smooth face that passes along a black spot down low and the right edge of a small overlap midway. The crux is characterized by steep smears for the feet and patina ripples for the hands.

Good climbing on fabulous rock with a short but sustained crux. Two stars out of five.
content.location:
This route climbs the very smooth face about 10 feet right of

RCA

.

content.description:
Runout but easy climbing along a smooth dike leads up and right to a small ledge on the right arete of the boulder. Clip a high bolt which protects moves around the arete then climb up into a crack to finish.

Best to set an directional in the crack if toproping,  as the anchor for RCA is far enough to the left to cause a bad swing.
content.location: This route is on the right arete of the RCA Boulder (aka: Boulder 4) which is visible as you near the Bond Boulders.
